publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1189# Mr Adam Ingram: Mental Health Carers-That the Parliament congratulates Trust: A Carers Connection on its campaigning for the rights of carers of the mentally ill in Ayrshire; recognises the specific needs of these carers; believes that the rights of carers of people with mental illness should be at least the same as those of other carers, particularly in relation to consultation over care issues concerning the patient, and acknowledges the invaluable work carried out by these carers.
S1M-1189# Mental Health Carers (lodged on 15 September 2000) Dorothy-Grace Elder*, Ms Sandra White*, Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-1189# Mental Health Carers (lodged on 15 September 2000) Fiona McLeod*, Christine Grahame*, David Mundell*, Michael Russell*, Fiona Hyslop*

S1M-1189# Mr Adam Ingram: Mental Health Carers—That the Parliament congratulates Trust: A Carers Connection on its campaigning for the rights of carers of the mentally ill in Ayrshire; recognises the specific needs of these carers; believes that the rights of carers of people with mental illness should be at least the same as those of other carers, particularly in relation to consultation over care issues concerning the patient, and acknowledges the invaluable work carried out by these carers. Supported by: Dorothy-Grace Elder, Ms Sandra White, Tommy Sheridan, Fiona McLeod, Christine Grahame, David Mundell, Michael Russell, Fiona Hyslop
S1M-1189# Mental Health Carers (lodged on 15 September 2000) Donald Gorrie*, Shona Robison*
S1M-1189# Mental Health Carers (lodged on 15 September 2000) Fergus Ewing*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Irene McGugan*, Andrew Wilson*
S1M-1189# Mental Health Carers (lodged on 15 September 2000) Phil Gallie*, Alex Neil*, Mr Jamie McGrigor*
S1M-1189# Mental Health Carers (lodged on 15 September 2000) John Scott*

S1M-1189# Mr Adam Ingram: Mental Health Carers—That the Parliament congratulates Trust: A Carers Connection on its campaigning for the rights of carers of the mentally ill in Ayrshire; recognises the specific needs of these carers; believes that the rights of carers of people with mental illness should be at least the same as those of other carers, particularly in relation to consultation over care issues concerning the patient, and acknowledges the invaluable work carried out by these carers. Supported by: Dorothy-Grace Elder, Ms Sandra White, Tommy Sheridan, Fiona McLeod, Christine Grahame, David Mundell, Michael Russell, Fiona Hyslop, Donald Gorrie, Shona Robison, Fergus Ewing, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Irene McGugan, Andrew Wilson, Phil Gallie, Alex Neil, Mr Jamie McGrigor, John Scott, Roseanna Cunningham*, Mr Gil Paterson*
S1M-1189# Mental Health Carers (lodged on 15 September 2000) Mrs Margaret Ewing*
S1M-1189# Mental Health Carers (lodged on 15 September 2000) Mr David Davidson*
S1M-1189# Mental Health Carers (lodged on 15 September 2000) Nora Radcliffe*

S1M-1189# Mr Adam Ingram: Mental Health Carers—That the Parliament congratulates Trust: A Carers Connection on its campaigning for the rights of carers of the mentally ill in Ayrshire; recognises the specific needs of these carers; believes that the rights of carers of people with mental illness should be at least the same as those of other carers, particularly in relation to consultation over care issues concerning the patient, and acknowledges the invaluable work carried out by these carers. Supported by: Dorothy-Grace Elder, Ms Sandra White, Tommy Sheridan, Fiona McLeod, Christine Grahame, David Mundell, Michael Russell, Fiona Hyslop, Donald Gorrie, Shona Robison, Fergus Ewing, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Irene McGugan, Andrew Wilson, Phil Gallie, Alex Neil, Mr Jamie McGrigor, John Scott, Roseanna Cunningham, Mr Gil Paterson, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Mr David Davidson, Nora Radcliffe, Mary Scanlon*, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*
